ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to do a peer review, how to present on a research paper, how to analyse data using R
doing my thesis
wrote my thesis and reviewed and heard about others'
I learned about everyone elses thesis topics and received feedback on mine.
Working on the senior thesis
I learned how to conduct an in-depth research topic and how to write a long scientific paper on it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: lovely to meet and discuss ideas with other cognitive science majors, see others get excited and talk passionately about their projects, build a sense of community in the major through the senior thesis requirement
weaknesses: making the grade separate from the thesis' final grade might more effectively motivate people to turn up and listen to others' presentations?
could've been helpful to get more advice on thesis research instead of only student presentations, or even more interactive small group discussions about our projects
The Cognitive Science senior project should be a year-long course!! It is so much harder to stay on top of the projects without the structure and support of a weekly colloquium.
getting to see everyone's projects and garner feedback is helpful, maybe a bit more support and direct guidance could be useful

Strengths - leaning about others and getting feedback on own
Weakness - perhaps more time could be devoted to individual thesis
Just an opportunity to present your thesis work and learn from your classmates. No strengths or weaknesses

I really liked how we were able to collaborate and share with each other what we were learning, get feedback as well as provide it. However I think in the future we should only do a couple days of presentations at the end of the semester, once we have finished our research. Otherwise, the class should be more of a check in or office hours or concentrated time to work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! writing a thesis at Yale is super rewarding, and Isaac Davis is a wonderful lecturer who cares sincerely about people's work and ideas.
it is required so yes
It's required
I loved this course. Great way to end my Yale experience, meet other CogSci majors, and get advice on writing my thesis.
well if you are a senior cogsci student ye
If you are a cog sci major, you must take it. But yes it was interesting to learn from everyone else!
You have to take this course if you're a senior in the cognitive science major
